Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an invasion of privacy and a threat to freedom of speech and expression.
Debate and the ability to express differing opinions are essential in a democracy.
Historical examples show that widely accepted medical beliefs have been proven wrong, highlighting the importance of open debate.
The proposed powers could lead to government control similar to dictatorships or communism.
The ACMA or any organization should not have the power to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Censorship could suppress minority or fringe voices that may be correct.
Notable Quotes: I do not consent to this bill being introduced, and believe it is sadly a gross invasion of our privacy, and fundamental human rights and freedom of speech and expression.
If this is no longer allowed and our opinions are not able to be expressed, then it is now no longer a democracy.
The answer to scientific or political controversies is more debate not more censorship.
